summary: This is an email chain from November 30, 2018, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing coordination on the Epstein case. It mentions drafting a memo, being in touch with the FBI regarding the review of an old case file, and reacting to a New York Times article.

events.title: Internal US Attorney's Office Coordination on Epstein Case
events.description: Email chain among USANYS personnel discussing the need to draft a memo, coordinate with the FBI who is reviewing an old case file, and address a New York Times article.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively discussing the Epstein case internally on November 30, 2018.
The office was drafting a memo and was in touch with the FBI, which was in the process of pulling and reviewing an old case file related to Epstein.
The correspondence was prompted, in part, by another article published in The New York Times that day.
All sender/recipient names in the email chain are redacted, indicated by the placeholder "(USANYS)".
